intro: Karrabina biagiana, commonly known as the mountain heath, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes heathers and blueberries, and is characterized by its dense, compact growth habit. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale pink, blooming in late summer. Its leaves are evergreen, leathery, and arranged in a spiral pattern around the stem. Karrabina biagiana thrives in well-drained, acidic soils and is adapted to cold, mountainous climates.
